Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Membro dell'editorial board di Sociologica (rivista indicizzata da Scopus)
Review editor del Journal of Artificial Societies and Social Simulation (rivista indicizzata da WoS e Scopus)
Membro dell'editorial board della Wiley Book Series on Computational and Quantitative Social Science
Membro dell'editorial board di Sistemi Intelligenti (rivista indicizzata su Scopus)
Editor in chief del Journal of Artificial Societies and Social Simulation (rivista indicizzata da WoS e Scopus)
Membro dell'editorial board della Springer Book Series on Computational Social Science

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Chair e organizzatore dell’International Workshop EPOS Epistemological Perspectives on Simulation, Università degli Studi di Brescia
Invited Keynote al Workshop on "Computational and Mathematical Approaches to Societal Transitions", DRIFT (Dutch Research Institute for Transitions), Leiden, The Netherlands

Presentazione del paper "The Relevance of Empirical Foundations of Agent-Based Simulations in the Social Sciences” (co-autore Riccardo Boero), EMAEE 2007 Conference on “Globalisation, Services and Innovation: The Changing Dynamics of the Knowledge Economy”, Manchester Metropolitan University, UK

Presentazione del paper "Does Cognition (Really and Always) Matter? The Vexata Quaestio of the Micro-Foundations of Agent-Based Models from a Sociological Viewpoint”, The Fourth Conference of the European Social Simulation Association, Università degli Studi di Toulouse, Francia

Presentazione del paper “Reputational Cues in Repeated Trust Games” (co-autori Riccardo Boero, Giangiacomo Bravo e Marco Castellani), The 38th World Congress of International Institute of Sociology, Central European University, Budapest
Chair e organizzatore della "Fifth Conference of the European Social Simulation Association", Università degli Studi di Brescia

Presentazione del paper "Third Party Reputation in Repeated Trust Games" (co-autori Riccardo Boero, Giangiacomo Bravo, Francesco Laganà e Marco Castellani), The ICORE-The First International Conference on Reputation: Theory and Technology, Gargonza, Italy

Presentazione del paper “Victims of Microscopicness: The Added Value of Social Simulation Models for Analytical Sociology”, The International Workshop on "Mechanisms and Analytical Sociology", Università degli Studi di Torino

Presentazione del paper “An Experimental Data-Driven Social Simulation Model on Trust” (co-autori Riccardo Boero e Giangiacomo Bravo), Sixth Conference of the European Social Simulation Association, Università del Surrey, Gilford, UK

Presentazione del paper "Why Bother With What Others Tell You? An Experimentally Driven Social Simulation Model” (co-autori Riccardo Boero, Giangiacomo Bravo e Marco Castellani), The 5th European Social Simulation Association Conference, Università degli Studi di Brescia
Presentazione del paper “Experimentally Grounded Social Simulation” (co-autore Giangiacomo Bravo), World Congress on Social Simulation, Università di Kassel, Germania
